conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your community. I’m ready to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A) for a single seat, so applying immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, making it the safest way to secure a top-3 outcome quickly. I will apply to School_C now to lock in a strong match rather than risk ending up at a lower option later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application. We’re delighted by your interest in School_C and are happy to offer you admission. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list and has submitted an [APPLY] in round 1. With quota 1, accepting now secures our top-choice student and avoids the risk of losing them to School_A or School_B, which Student_B ranks above School_C. No other applicants are in the inbox this round, and there is no higher-ranked candidate than Student_B for us. Therefore, immediate acceptance is optimal.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly prefer your academic environment and would commit to enrolling if accepted. I’m motivated to contribute positively in class and school activities and would be grateful for the opportunity to join School_B.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks Student_E and Student_B above me, applying now gives me the best chance before they potentially lock in elsewhere. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase the likelihood of acceptance if I’m the best available candidate this round.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your commitment and the thoughtful note about contributing to our academic community. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B, and we look forward to having you join us.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. Student_C is currently applying and is my 3rd choice—acceptable, but I should consider whether I can realistically secure Student_E or Student_B if I wait. Student_E’s preferences rank School_B last, so it’s very unlikely they will apply to me early (or at all) unless rejected everywhere else. Student_B ranks School_B second but ranks School_A first; School_A’s top priorities are E and D ahead of B, so Student_B might get rejected by School_A and then apply to me, but that is uncertain and could take multiple rounds. I have a quota of 1 and an immediate solid applicant (Student_C) who ranks me first, meaning they will commit and reduce risk of ending unmatched. Given the uncertainty of attracting Student_B and the low likelihood of Student_E, accepting Student_C now maximizes expected outcome while still being high on my list.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—School_B is my first choice. I’m very interested in your program and community, and I’d like to learn what qualities you prioritize most in candidates this year (academics, activities, interviews, etc.). If there’s anything I can share to demonstrate my fit and commitment to School_B, please let me know.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. However, since this is round 1 and outcomes depend on others’ moves, I should still signal strong interest to School_B to keep any chance alive. Using [TALK] lets me express fit and commitment without forcing an early rejection, and I can pivot to School_C next if needed.

conversation.message: Hello Student_A—thank you for reaching out and for your strong interest in School_B. In our review, we prioritize (1) sustained academic performance and course rigor, (2) clear fit with School_B’s learning culture (curiosity, collaboration, and initiative), and (3) meaningful extracurricular or community involvement with depth/impact over sheer number of activities. If you’d like to share a brief note on (a) the most challenging course you’ve taken and what you learned from it, and (b) one activity where you’ve made a tangible contribution or shown leadership, we can better understand your fit and commitment.
conversation.thought: We have quota 0 and are already matched with Student_C via an [ACCEPT] this round. Student_A is only initiating [TALK], so I should respond with [TALK] (not accept/reject). Given our true priority list, Student_A is lowest, and even if capacity opened later, we would prefer higher-ranked students; however, for now we can provide info and keep the conversation positive without implying availability.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the chance to join your community. I believe I would be a strong fit and would commit seriously if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B’s priority ranks me 4th (behind E, B, C). Given each school has capacity 1 and several students rank School_B highly, an [APPLY] is likely to be rejected. My second choice School_C ranks me 3rd, but Student_B (ranked 1st by School_C) will likely apply there, making an immediate [APPLY] risky as well. School_A is my 3rd choice and crucially ranks me 2nd (behind only Student_E). Since Student_E’s top choices are School_C then School_D, E may not apply to School_A first. Therefore, applying to School_A now maximizes my chance of securing a relatively high-ranked match quickly rather than risking rejection at B/C and ending up much lower.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing applications this round and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority list ranks Student_E above Student_D. In this round, both Student_D and Student_E applied. Since accepting Student_D now would fill the quota and block a match with higher-priority Student_E (who is also applying and states commitment), the optimal move is to reject Student_D to preserve capacity for Student_E. Student_D also ranks School_A third (after School_B and School_C), so their commitment may be weaker than Student_E’s, further supporting rejection.

conversation.message: Hello School_A. I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the academic environment and opportunities your school offers. I would be honored to join your incoming class and will commit fully if accepted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Those students also rank School_C very highly, so an immediate [APPLY] is likely to be rejected. In contrast, School_A is my 3rd choice and I am School_A’s top priority, so applying there now should secure a guaranteed match and avoid the risk of ending up much lower. Therefore I will apply to School_A.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We were impressed by your message and are pleased to offer you admission to School_A.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list, so accepting them maximizes our objective. Student_E also applied directly to us (and ranks School_A 3rd), but even if they might prefer School_C/School_D, an [ACCEPT] secures the match per rules. Student_D is #2 on our list but inferior to Student_E, and we already rejected Student_D. Therefore accept Student_E now.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

I’m Student_D, and I’m writing to formally apply. School_E is an important choice for me, and I’m genuinely excited about the possibility of joining your community. I would take the opportunity seriously and would be ready to commit promptly if admitted.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain. On my true preference list, School_E (4th) is preferred over School_D (5th), so I should prioritize School_E. Given the round-based system and limited capacity, I should [APPLY] now rather than [TALK] to avoid losing the last acceptable seat. I will express strong interest and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your interest in School_E. After reviewing our current applicant pool and available capacity for this round, we are not able to offer you admission.

We appreciate the time and care you put into your application, and we wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranking is A > C > B > E > D. I have quota 1 and currently no matches. In this round, both Student_D and Student_A applied. Student_A is my top-ranked student overall, while Student_D is my lowest-ranked acceptable student. Given the matching environment, accepting Student_D now would fill my only seat and prevent me from matching with Student_A (who is applying right now) or potentially Student_C/Student_B in later rounds. Therefore, to maximize my outcome on my true priority list, I should reject Student_D and preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates, especially Student_A.

conversation.message:
Hello School_E Admissions Committee—thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]

School_E is one of my top choices because I’m looking for a community where I can contribute actively and grow academically. I’m a consistent, hardworking student who takes challenging coursework seriously, and I try to bring the same commitment to group projects and school activities.

Beyond academics, I value being reliable and helpful in a community—stepping up when something needs to be organized, supporting peers, and following through on responsibilities. If admitted, I would be excited to contribute to School_E through sustained involvement in clubs and service, and by being an engaged, collaborative classmate.

I’d be grateful for the opportunity to join School_E and would accept an offer enthusiastically.
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E is ranked above School_D, so I should prioritize securing School_E now rather than risk ending unmatched. I will submit a formal application emphasizing fit and what I can contribute, aligning with common admissions priorities (academics, community involvement, initiative) to maximize acceptance chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for the clear commitment you’ve shown to contributing to our community. After reviewing your materials, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

If you choose to join us, we look forward to the reliability, collaboration, and sustained involvement you described.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_A highest. Student_A has applied and is acceptable. Although Student_A ranks School_E 4th, an immediate accept secures our top choice; waiting risks losing them to other schools while we have no higher-priority applicant available. Student_D is lowest on our list and already rejected. Therefore accept Student_A now to maximize outcome on our priority list.

conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched. School_D is on my true preference list (though last), and I prefer matching to being unmatched. Given the one-seat capacity and that School_D ranks me #1 in its priority list, a direct application should be accepted if the seat is still open.
